stories.text:
I'm working on a new app and it will require some short video clips; I'm semi-set on using Vimeo over YouTube/other options and wondering if others have run into any issues, or if this is generally not a good idea. The app itself is more/less a 'workout app' though highly specialized, and will only need to show very short video clips around 10-20 seconds in most cases. Long-term I could see offering students the ability to record/upload their own videos for feedback from staff members, etc.

From what I'm seeing the Vimeo api looks like a really easy, clean and inexpensive option.

Thank you
stories.title: Ask HN: Vimeo for Your App?
NFTs, OpenSea and Conflicts of Interest
The Hyundai Ioniq 5 is the best EV we drove in 2021
Crime Prediction SW Promised to Be Free of Biases. It Perpetuates Them
The Three Laws of Personal Devices

stories.text:
Hi HN,

A simple Wordpress website and server I manage has been suffering a DDOS recently, and my attempts to combat it via fail2ban failed, so I've ended up using Cloudflare. Putting a huge centralised service in between the website and its readers feels like a privacy failure to me.

It's a simple website hosted on a physical server. The DDOS attack is trying to brute force /xmlrpc.php and /wp-login.php, so I'd blocked all access to xmlrpc.php in nginx, jailed any ips who requested it in fail2ban, and rate limited access to /wp-login.php. But still endless requests to both are being made at numerous times a second from an endless series of ips, crashing the server on a daily basis. Now I've got Cloudflare in the way I'm hoping to turn away to buggers before they reach the server. But is there no decentralised alternative?
stories.title: Ask HN: A decentralised way to fight DDoS attacks?

stories.text:
With the Macbook M1, billions of smartphones running ARM and less and less sales of Intel chips, will we see the sudden rise of Linux and Windows desktops / laptops also switching to ARM?

Is x86 dead?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it me or are we entering an ARM era?
